org.jikesrvm.compilers.opt.lir2mir

Class MinimalBURS

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jikesrvm.compilers.opt.lir2mir.BURS
      • org.jikesrvm.compilers.opt.lir2mir.MinimalBURS

  • final class MinimalBURS
extends BURS
    This class contains code for quick and dirty instruction selection by forcing each instruction to be a tree and generating the trees in the same input as the input LIR instructions. This results in poor code quality, but can be done very quickly. The intended purpose is to reduce compile time by doing quick and dirty instruction selection for infrequently executed basic blocks.
    See Also:
    BURS_StateCoder, AbstractBURS_TreeNode

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        public void invoke(BasicBlock bb)
        Build BURS trees for the basic block bb, label the trees, and then generate MIR instructions based on the labeling.
        Parameters:
        bb - the basic block to process

      • buildTree

        private AbstractBURS_TreeNode buildTree(Instruction s)
        Build a BURS Tree for each Instruction. Complete BURS trees by adding leaf nodes as needed, and creating tree edges by calling insertChild1() or insertChild2() This step is also where we introduce intermediate tree nodes for any LIR instruction that has > 2 "real" operands e.g., a CALL.
        Parameters:
        s - The instruction for which a tree must be built
        Returns:
        the root of the newly constructed tree

      • generateTree

        private void generateTree(AbstractBURS_TreeNode k,
                          BURS_StateCoder burs)
        Generates code for a single tree root.
        Parameters:
        k - the root to start generation at
        burs - the current BURS state
